700766f-a.title: Bronx: City Island Avenue - Tier Street
700766f-a.text:
City Island Avenue (City --sland), west side, south from
(No. 3G7) Tier Street. At the N. W. corner of Bay Street is the
Trinity Methodist Episcopal Church. Note the sign over No. 367,
reading: Governor Smith for President, Headquarters City Island
Non-Partisan Association.
July 26, 1928
P. L. Sperr
700766f-a.folder: City Island Avenue & Tier Street, Bronx, NY

700750f-a.title: Bronx: City Island Avenue - Tier Street
700750f-a.text:
357 and 365 City IIsland Ave. (City Island), at and adjoining the
N.W. corner of Tier Street. The old frame house, No. 365, according to
Beers' map of 1868 was the homestead of Ino Ross. Note that the numbers
do not follow in successive order.
July 26, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
700750f-a.folder: City Island Avenue & Tier Street, Bronx, NY

701609f-b.title: Bronx: City Island Road - Tier Street
701609f-b.text:
(1)
Pelham Bay Park: A view of the Marshall Mansion, on the north side
of City Island Road, about three hundred yards west of City lIsland
Bridge. The house is still standing at this date (1937), but is
unoccupied.
1910.
Gift of Randall Comfort.
(2)
The same, at a later date.
May 29, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
701609f-b.folder: City Island Road & Tier Street, Bronx, NY

701610f-a.title: Bronx: City Island Road - Tier Street
701610f-a.text:
Pelham Bay Park: A front view of the Marshall Mansion, on the north
side of City Island Road, about 300 yards west of City Island Bridge. It
is situated on the former L.R. Marshall estate and is still standing at
this date (1937).
June 1926.
Brown Brothers.
701610f-a.folder: City Island Road & Tier Street, Bronx, NY
